comment.author: 73509022@N00
comment._content: "She was the first and only German capital ship to ever visit the United States. On May 11, 1912 she left Kiel, accompanied by light cruisers SMS Stettin and SMS Bremen, and arrived off Hampton Roads, Virginia, on May 30, 1912. After touring the East Coast for two weeks, she returned to Kiel on June 24." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SMS_Moltke_(1910)

comment.author: 9057009@N02
comment._content: A German Battle Cruiser. Her visit caused a stir with fears that the Germans might be able to attack the US, but in fact she had to burn some of her wooden furniture just to make the one way trip.

comment.author: 73509022@N00
comment._content: More on the visit here: www.bobhenneman.info/moltkevisit.htm and query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C05E3D7153CE633A...
